name: MKMapView.CameraZoomRange
desc: A camera zoom range that limits the distances to which the user can zoom.

items.name: init?(minCenterCoordinateDistance: CLLocationDistance, maxCenterCoordinateDistance: CLLocationDistance)
items.desc: Create a camera zoom range by specifying a minimum and maximum distance from your map view’s center coordinates, measured in meters.

items.name: init?(minCenterCoordinateDistance: CLLocationDistance)
items.desc: Create a camera zoom range by specifying the minimum distance from your map view’s center coordinate, measured in meters.

items.name: init?(maxCenterCoordinateDistance: CLLocationDistance)
items.desc: Create a camera zoom range by specifying the maximum distance from your map view’s center coordinate, measured in meters.

items.name: let MKMapCameraZoomDefault: CLLocationDistance
items.desc: A constant value used to represent the default value for zooming in or out on a map.

items.name: var maxCenterCoordinateDistance: CLLocationDistance
items.desc: The maximum distance of the camera to the center of the map, measured in meters.

items.name: var minCenterCoordinateDistance: CLLocationDistance
items.desc: The minimum distance of the camera to the center of the map, measured in meters.
